conversion_verification.notes: The 3D render successfully demonstrates a true 3D conversion with visible wall height, thickness, perceptible interior volume, an angled view, and a removed roof/ceiling.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Excellent dimensional transformation with clear walls, floors, and volume. Viewing angle is good. Minor perspective distortion due to the angle chosen, but not severe. Cutaway is clean.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Room configuration is mostly correct with good adjacency and proportions. Major wall positions align well. Doors are present but some windows seem missing or very simplified (e.g., in BED-1). Proportionality of openings could be better in some instances.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture, kitchen, and bathroom fixtures are present and correctly placed. The scale is reasonable and orientation logical relative to the layout.

visual_clarity.notes: Structural elements are clearly distinguishable. Interior is well-lit and readable. Consistent material usage. Minor rendering artifact with overlapping wall text from the 2D plan in Bed-1.

detected_errors.description: Some windows are missing or overly simplified in the 3D model compared to the 2D plan (e.g., window next to Bed-1).
Ghosting of text labels from the original 2D plan ('BED-1', 'MON-X' in the bathroom next to BED-1) is visible on the walls in the 3D model, detracting from visual cleanliness.

summary: The 2D to 3D conversion is very successful, demonstrating a geometrically faithful transformation with high accuracy in layout and interior elements, although some minor detailing and text ghosting could be improved.
